materials.raw_text: Co: 60 g, Fe: 10 g, Si: 180 g, Tc: 120 g

sourcing.instructions: Co (Cobalt powder) - Available from chemical supply stores or online suppliers; Fe (Iron powder) - Obtainable from metallurgy suppliers; Si (Silicon powder) - Found in chemical suppliers; Tc (Technetium powder) - Rare, may need special licensing, consider contacting nuclear material suppliers.
steps: Co (Cobalt powder) - Available from chemical supply stores or online suppliers; Fe (Iron powder) - Obtainable from metallurgy suppliers; Si (Silicon powder) - Found in chemical suppliers; Tc (Technetium powder) - Rare, may need special licensing, consider contacting nuclear material suppliers.

1. Measure out each ingredient precisely using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine the Co, Fe, Si, and Tc powders. 3. Mix thoroughly using a mortar and pestle or a mechanical mixer until a homogeneous mixture is achieved. 4. Transfer the mixture to a crucible suitable for high-temperature applications.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure out each ingredient precisely using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine the Co, Fe, Si, and Tc powders. 3. Mix thoroughly using a mortar and pestle or a mechanical mixer until a homogeneous mixture is achieved. 4. Transfer the mixture to a crucible suitable for high-temperature applications.

steps: 1. Preheat the furnace to 1200 °C. 2. Place the crucible with the mixture inside the furnace. 3. Heat for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and sintering of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat the furnace to 1200 °C. 2. Place the crucible with the mixture inside the furnace. 3. Heat for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and sintering of the materials.

steps: 1. After heating, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally. 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled completely (approximately 4-6 hours).
cooling.raw_text: 1. After heating, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally. 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled completely (approximately 4-6 hours).

steps: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible carefully using appropriate tools. 2. Inspect for any rough edges or imperfections. 3. Sand the surface with fine-grade sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to protect the surface if needed.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible carefully using appropriate tools. 2. Inspect for any rough edges or imperfections. 3. Sand the surface with fine-grade sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to protect the surface if needed.
